title: Blizzard's "Biggest Year Yet" Coming In 2026 For 35th Anniversary, President Says
description: Blizzard Entertainment president Johanna Faries has said fans of the Diablo and Warcraft company can look forward to what she hopes will be Blizzard's "biggest year yet" in 2026. 2026 marks the 35th anniversary of Blizzard, and Faries told Variety that the company has a "bold vision" for what's coming next. "The teams across Blizzard entirely, as an organization, are gearing up for what we hope to be the biggest year yet for Blizzard, and we take that statement very seriously," Faries said. "And it's all part of this new, bold vision for the future." Continue Reading at GameSpot

Baldur's Gate 3 Actor Sounds Off On Using AI For Voice Roles: "F**k AI In Performance"
description: Actor Neil Newbon, who voiced Astarion in Baldur's Gate 3, has shared his thoughts on artificial intelligence in gaming, and he didn't mince words. "Fuck AI in performance," Newbon told PCGamesN. He's talking about using artificial voice lines for games, like how Embark's The Finals and Arc Raiders do. For Arc Raiders, the studio hired human actors to record voice lines and then used AI systems to have their voices say lots of other things. Newbon pointed out that Arc Raiders has been a major commercial success, and he suggested that Embark bring back the actors to "redo the lines." Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: World War Z's New DLC Adds The Walking Dead Characters To Another Zombie Apocalypse
description: Two of the biggest zombie franchises are teaming up as World War Z's next story campaign DLC will cross over with The Walking Dead. Players will be able to take control of four of the iconic characters from the show--Rick Grimes, Daryl Dixon, Negan, and Michonne--with The Walking Dead stars Andrew Lincoln and Norman Reedus reprising their roles as Rick and and Daryl, respectively. The first trailer for the crossover should look very familiar to fans of both franchises. The new episodic campaign will unfold over three stories that revisit locations from The Walking Dead, including Grady Memorial Hospital, the Prison, and the Alexandria Safe Zone. But don't count on facing The Walking Dead's infamously slow hordes of walkers. This DLC is pitting the characters against a new incarnation of World War Z's Zeke swarms. There's also a fresh take on a Zeke called Spiked Walkers. This zombie is impervious to melee attacks unless it's been knocked over. However, the window of opportunity to take it out is short, and once it's back on its feet, it's no longer vulnerable. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: When Is The Next Steam Sale? Dates For 2026 Spring Sale And More Fests Revealed
description: While it's always a good idea to save some cash toward the end of the month, Valve's quarterly Steam sales make it very tempting to dip into those rainy day funds. Fortunately, knowing when these sales will occur has gotten easier over time, as Valve no longer keeps people guessing about the dates. The company regularly posts the dates far in advance for its sales and promotional events, and for the upcoming Steam Winter Sale 2025, this will kick off on December 18 and runs through January 5, 2026. Beyond that, Valve has also dated several other events for the rest of the year, ranging from a fresh batch of demos being dropped in the February Next Fest to a spring sale starting in March. There'll also be promotions with specific focuses throughout the year, highlighting mystery, tower defense, and PvP games. Here's the full list of everything on the way. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Sony’s Fight Against A Horizon Lookalike Has Come To An End
description: Following its decision to sue Tencent for creating a "slavish clone" of its Horizon games, Light of Motiram, Sony has concluded its legal battle with the company. The game is no longer listed on Steam or the Epic Games Store, and the court case has been dismissed. That's according to new court documents filed earlier this week, and Tencent added that it has reached a "confidential settlement" with Sony Interactive Entertainment. "SIE and Tencent are pleased to have reached a confidential resolution and will have no further public comment on this matter," head of communications for Tencent Americas, Sean Durkin, said to The Verge. Announced last year, Light of Motiram was quickly compared to Sony's Horizon series as it featured a very similar art direction and tone to the post-apocalyptic sci-fi series developed by Guerrilla Games. Both games featured vibrant environments and animal-like robots, and Sony was quick to file a lawsuit. Sony and Tencent eventually began discussions to resolve the dispute, with Sony demanding that Tencent pause all public promotion or testing for Light of Motiram. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: The Forge Quest Guide - How to Complete All Main Quests
description: The Forge is rapidly becoming one of the most popular Roblox games in no small part due to its brilliant tutorial quest system and gameplay. The Forge is a fascinating mix of different types of games from gacha titles to open-world RPG games to even crafting simulators. And that is all before bringing up the fact that The Forge offers quests that will task you with engaging in its fast-paced action combat system against hordes of zombies. There is something for everyone in The Forge Roblox, so if you want to check it out, it all starts with the quests you get in it. Table of Contents [hide]Where to Find All Quest NPCs Where to Find All Quest NPCs There are quite a few named NPCs you will meet during your time playing The Forge. Though some characters will immediately appear near your spawn point or the game will direct you to where they are located, that isn’t always the case. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: The Forge Ore Guide - How to Find All Ore
description: There is so much for players to do in Roblox’s The Forge, and one of the most important gameplay features is collecting all of the different ore types. While a major goal of the game is to use the titular forge to craft weapons for combat and money, you need ore to do that. Players can get all of the different types of ore in The Forge using your various pickaxes, and some of The Forge codes that are kicking around may be able to help with that. That said, with dozens of ores available in the highly popular Roblox experience, it can be quite confusing where to find all of them. Here is what you need to know about where to find all the ore in The Forge. We've also got a handy The Forge tier list, so you know which ore is best. Table of Contents [hide]Where to Find All Ore in The Forge - Stonewake’s Cross Where to Find All Ore in The Forge - Stonewake’s Cross The general idea is you need a pickaxe equipped to be able to mash at the rocks in the various caves and biomes in The Forge. Destroying these different types of rocks will give you the chance to obtain various ores and stones. There are a few additional gemstones and ores that can be found by defeating certain enemies as well. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Escape From Tarkov Has Reached A Major Sales Milestone
description: After more than eight years in beta, extraction shooter Escape from Tarkov finally saw its 1.0 release on November 15. Now, developer Battlestate Games has revealed that the game has sold over 1 million copies in the month following release. Unlike some early access titles, participating in Escape from Tarkov's beta required a purchase of one of the game's various pre-order editions, so the post-release sales will mostly represent newcomers to the game. Battlestate Games controversially required that players re-purchase the game if they wanted to play it on Steam, even if they already purchased it directly from Battlestate. Escape from Tarkov also saw some controversy around its sales strategy when the studio revealed a $250 pre-order edition that unlocked access to an exclusive PVE mode, and other features that players called out as pay-to-win. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Tomb Raider Remake Will Be Easier To Cater For "Modern Player Tastes"
description: Crystal Dynamics announced Tomb Raider: Legacy of Atlantis last week at The Game Awards, calling it a reimagining of the original 1996 Tomb Raider. While the studio wants to stay faithful to the original, it has also said it plans to tone down the brutal difficulty of the nearly 30-year-old PlayStation 1 game. Speaking in a press conference, as reported by GamesRadar, Crystal Dynamics developer Will Kerslake was asked about adapting the original PS1 game specifically when it comes to difficulty. Like many games of its era, the 1996 game was known to have its punishingly difficult sections, including insta-kill death traps that were often near-impossible to avoid without the benefit of hindsight. "Part of reimagining a game right is adjusting that game evolving for modern player tastes," Kerslake said, and though he doesn't explicitly mention difficulty it seems safe to say that Legacy of Atlantis will have far fewer insta-kills. That doesn't mean the game will be a walk in the park, however. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Dbrand Killswitch Grip Case Bundle For Switch 2 Discounted At Best Buy
description: Dbrand Killswitch Grip Case Travel Bundle for Switch 2 $72 (was $80) Get deal at Best Buy See at Dbrand The best grip we've tried for Nintendo Switch 2 is on sale at Best Buy as a last-minute holiday deal. Dbrand's Killswitch Grip Case Travel Bundle is discounted to $72 (was $80). Though it's pricier than many Switch 2 grips available on Amazon, the Killswitch has superb ergonomics, a clever dock adapter that works seamlessly, and a three-piece design that lets you use the grips for mouse mode and single Joy-Con 2 motion controls. Additionally, the Travel Bundle replaces the need for a traditional carrying case since it has a detachable hardshell cover with a built-in slots for game cards. Continue Reading at GameSpot
